comment.realname: Canterbury City Council Sydney, NSW, Australia
comment.author: 48681824@N08
comment._content: We love this series of his historical photos!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/canterburycity] It's great isn't it - so much interesting stuff at ultra-hi resolution to really find details.  And many of these images seem to be very rare, if not one-offs.

Big thanks to [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33147718@N05] for sharing the Edward Hungerford Album on Flickr.  And to Edward Hungerford for collecting the photos together in the first place!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Strange - this Charles Bayliss photo shows statues in the niches of the Great Hall - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.pic-vn4193369

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article63512635 1865 Illustrated Sydney News item ; nla.gov.au/nla.news-page5408536 accompanying illustration [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] ...I suspect those statues in the Charles Bayliss pic are phantoms...with the vacant pedestals, contrasting shades of stonework and shadows all combining to give an illusion of white shapes in the niches...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] As mentioned, the different coloured brickwork makes it hard to distinguish shapes in the niches:
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/canterburycity] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Glad everyone has enjoyed Mr Hungerford's album, it's a treasure trove. We have now reached the end of the Hungerford collection (sob!) however there are many more albums to uncover :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] It's a fantastic album...and (as with all the other pics), thanks to everyone who made the album available and put the pics on line...I've been too busy to look properly at every pic yet...saving a few for a rainy week-end!
